subject: Re: [junit] Runing only one Test class not the whole Suite
msgSnippet: ... Could you give us an example of how the TestSuite holds initialization stuff?  Could that initialization stuff live within the test case s local fixture
messageBody:
quadzillarider wrote:

>I am using the swing test runner and want to only run one of my test
>classes not the entire Suite. But the TestSuite holds initialization
>stuff so it must run. Is there a way I can start the TestSuite, run
>the intialization then get to choose which test from a class I want to
>run?
>
>

Could you give us an example of how the TestSuite holds initialization
stuff? Could that initialization stuff live within the test case's
local fixture rather than a global fixture?

I've seen this occur when using TestSetup to define global fixtures.
The symptom is that tests must be run within the context of TestSetup
to pass. That's an unfortunate situation borne out of undesirable
coupling between multiple test cases and a common test fixture. My
experience has been that breaking these dependencies can do wonders for
the design.

Please post a concrete example so we can help.

Mike
